title: Republican debate as it happened - BBC News
summary: ten republican 2016 candidates have held their first debate in cleveland .
frontrunner donald trump was attacked by his rivals .
rand paul and chris christie clashed over surveillance .
fox news selected the 10 by popularity based on polls .
carly fiorina declared by fox news as winner of earlier debate .

documents.title: good night
text: that concludes our live coverage of the first 2016 republican presidential debate .
thanks for joining us .
you can follow the latest updates on the campaign at

documents.title: that 's a wrap
text: the candidates have left the stage .

documents.title: closing thoughts
text: around a thousand grass-roots activists packed a ballroom in an atlanta hotel to watch tonight 's republican debate , and they 're going home thrilled with the performance .
the verdict from the crowd here was n't difficult to up .

moderates like john kasich and jeb bush did n't do anything to win them over - even eliciting boos on occasion - while conservative darlings like ted cruz and marco rubio garnered positive reviews even if they had limited opportunities to really shine .
donald trump was generally seen as an amusing sideshow .
`` he 's not a real republican , '' said tarya o'neill from madison , wisconsin .
`` i hope people know that now '' .
sandy rabe of cincinnati , ohio , said she liked some of the things he said , `` but i hope he does n't become president '' .
rabe added that she wished carly fiorina , the former business executive , had gotten a chance to show her stuff on the stage .
she is roundly considered to have dominated the earlier debate among lower-tier candidates .

there will be considerable pontificating and prognosticating after tonight 's festivities , but the one thing this campaign has shown so far is that conventional wisdom and educated predictions are more often wrong than right .
author: Anthony Zurcher, BBC News

documents.title: huckabee 'surprise of the night '
text: many people participating in the same focus group , appearing on fox news after the debate , said mike huckabee was the surprise of the night .
one participant said he was `` articulate , relatable and made very good points '' .

documents.title: clinton hangs with kim and kanye
text: hillary clinton was in california at a fundraising event while the republicans were debating .

kimkardashian

i really loved hearing her speak & hearing her goals for our country !
# hillaryforpresisent

documents.title: trump 'disappointing '
text: a republican focus group organised by leading political consultant frank luntz was asked if donald trump disappointed tonight .
several participants raised their hands .
they called ted cruz `` tough '' , `` smart '' and `` passionate . ''
one participant called scott walker a `` phony '' and another said marco rubio was `` articulate and impassioned . ''
some participants moved away from scott walker and donald trump , and said they now prefer mike huckabee or ted cruz .

documents.title: foreign policy dominated the discussion
text: data journalism website fivethirtyeight tracked what subjects garnered the most questions .

if i am elected i will make this country a total winner - i will make america great again .

text: gloria borger , cnn chief political analyst , says john kasich had a `` breakthrough night '' .
he spoke from the heart , she says .

documents.title: diminishing returns
text: as this republican debate enters the final stretch , some of the energy and excitement from the opening hour is starting to ebb away .
that should n't be surprising , as the early trump-led pyrotechnics set a very high bar for the rest of the evening .
fox made a controversial decision to limit the field to 10 candidates , but imagine what it would have been like with 12 , 14 or the full 17 on the stage .
even 10 is proving to be a cumbersome number , as candidates like walker , cruz , carson and even , of late , trump have disappeared into the background .
author: Anthony Zurcher, BBC News

documents.title: when did trump become a republican ?
text: megyn kelly asked mr trump , who has identified as a democrat in the past : `` when did you become a republican ? ''
`` i have evolved on many issues over the years .
so did ronald reagan i hate the concept of abortion .
i am pro-life .
i come from new york city which is almost exclusively democrat .
and i have really started to see some of the negatives the last two months of the [ george w ] bush presidency gave us president obama and you ca n't be happy about that . ''

documents.title: 'it 's great television '
text: at one point in round three of the republican debate , the fox moderators tried to nudge the candidates on the stage to turn their fire on the democrats and their frontrunner , hillary clinton .
they obliged , but it 's noteworthy how little time this evening has been spent going after the other party .
instead , the candidates have been forced to defend their records and past positions , while occasionally taking shots at their fellow conservatives .
it makes for great television , and it 's a sharp contrast from the stump speeches and candidate forums that have led up to tonight 's festivities .
author: Anthony Zurcher, BBC News

mike huckabee said the iran deal `` makes the world a more dangerous place '' and that iran gets everything it wants .

documents.title: rubio : common core is wrong
text: marco rubio said national education programme common core overreaches , and that the government 's requirements for education will always be too high .

jeb bush disagreed with his colleague from florida and said there must be high standards for education or `` families ' hearts will be broken '' when their children do not achieve high marks at school .

documents.title: pitched battles
text: could it be possible that the second 30 minutes of the debate was more dramatic than the first ?
it all started with a pitched battle between jeb bush and the rest of the republican field over immigration and ended with bush aggressively defending his support of common core education standards .
but the highlight was the much-anticipated face-off between rand paul and chris christie over government surveillance and national security .
donald trump continues to more than hold his own against the veteran politicians on the stage .
his only real stumble so far was when the fox moderators challenged him on his past support for a canadian-style single-payer healthcare system .
such a view is radioactive in the republican party from top to bottom .
author: Anthony Zurcher, BBC News

documents.title: cruz : obama should be more like el-sisi
text: ted cruz said president barack obama should be more like egyptian president abdel fattah el-sisi and not be afraid to call out radical islamic terrorism .

documents.title: paul , christie butt heads
text: `` i will make no apologies for protecting the lives and safety of the american people , '' chris christie said when asked about his support of the bulk collection of phone records .
rand paul said he wanted to collect more records from terrorists and less from us citizens .
mr christie said there is no way to differentiate .
mr paul then slammed mr christie for giving president obama a hug , to which mr christie said he only remembers giving people hugs in the wake of 9/11 .

documents.title: jeb bush on immigration
text: jeb bush on immigration

documents.title: on the defensive
text: thirty minutes into the debate , and it 's living up to its billing as must-see television .
donald trump is dominating the stage by sheer dint of his personality .
`` our leaders are stupid , '' he says , and you can almost feel the republican establishment cringe .
no one has made any big stumbles yet , but jeb bush , governor chris christie and senator rand paul probably had the toughest opening .

bush had to talk about his famous family name , christie was forced to defend new jersey 's underperforming economy , while paul had to explain foreign policy views that separate himself from much of the republican base .
author: Anthony Zurcher, BBC News

documents.title: kasich : trump may have a point
text: `` mr trump is touching a nerve because the us wants to see an end to illegal immigration , '' said mr kasich .
`` but we all have different ways of getting solutions . ''

documents.title: rand paul : is created is
text: asked why he blamed republican war `` hawks '' for the rise of the so-called islamic state , rand paul said only is is responsible for its terrorism , but the us should not be arming allies of the group .
`` is created themselves .
we will stop them by not funding them and not arming them . ''

documents.title: walker on abortion
text: megyn kelly asked scott walker if he would really let a mother die rather than have an abortion , a position he has continuously supported .
`` i 'm pro-life , always been pro life , and i think my position is consistent of that of many americans , '' said mr walker .
`` that 's an unborn child that 's in need of protection . ''
he called hillary clinton 's position on abortion `` radical '' .

documents.title: not just another bush
text: in florida they call me jeb because i earned it .

documents.title: viewers like trumpbbc reporter rajini vaidyanathan in cleveland
text: huge cheers among viewers here as # donaldtrump is asked about his record/quotes on women .

documents.title: trump 's history of name-calling women
text: megyn kelly asked mr trump about his history of calling women disparaging names .
he said : `` only rosie o'donnell . ''
`` i do n't have time for total political correctness , '' he said .
`` what i say is what i say .
if you do n't like it , i 'm sorry . ''

documents.title: rubio slams hillary clinton
text: `` this election can not be a resume competition , '' said marco rubio .
if it is that , then hillary clinton is the sure winner , he said .

documents.title: trump goes against the fray
text: and we 're off
asked if anybody would run their own third-party campaign against the eventual winner , only one person raised his hand : donald trump .
rand paul immediately jumps in to criticise him .
the gloves are off .

documents.title: all eyes on trumpthe bbc 's north america reporter tweets :
text: donald trump is big-footing the debate right out of the gate .
this is going to be good .

documents.title: trump centre stage ( literally )
text: the 10 men are now taking their places at the podiums , arranged in a way to reflect their place in the polls .
so donald trump is centre stage , with scott walker and jeb bush either side .

text: the ten middle aged men have taken the stage , all looking a bit awkward # gopdebate

documents.title: who caught the eye early on ?
text: the consensus appears to suggest carly fiorina was the winner of tonight 's earlier debate between the second tier of republican candidates - and google data shows she certainly got the attention of those watching .
out of the seven who took part , she was consistently the most-searched-for throughout the debate .
trailing her at the end was south carolina senator lindsey graham , who seems to have sparked lots of searches after talking about the death of his parents when he was in his 20s .
you can explore google 's coverage of tonight 's debates here .

documents.title: ted cruz , debate team captain
text: ted cruz , to appear in the later debate , rose to fame in 2011 after captivating the audience at the values voters summit .

his affinity for public speaking goes back to his university days - he was an award-winning debater at princeton university , winning the us national debating championship and the north american debating championship .
princeton even named a debate scholarship after him .

documents.title: what happened last time ?
text: there were at least 20 debates for republican presidential candidates in the 2012 election season .
at the first debate of that season , we heard from michele bachmann , herman cain , newt gingrich , ron paul , tim pawlenty , mitt romney and rick santorum .
that 's seven - 10 fewer than this time around .

documents.title: the democratic response
text: this may be a republican party , but the democrats are n't taking the night off .

the democrats ' official twitter account is a steady stream of swipes at the gop candidates , including this one referring to rick perry 's infamous 2012 stumble where he forgot the third government agency he wanted to cut .

documents.title: fiorina defends margaret thatcher comparison
text: earlier this week , carly fiorina compared herself to former uk prime minister margaret thatcher .
when asked tonight , she said does n't think the comparison is a stretch .
in the debate earlier tonight , she said she 's used to being the underdog , pointing out she started her professional career as a secretary and ended up as a ceo .

documents.title: 'more us troops to syria and iraq '
text: lindsey graham said during the early debate that he believes ground troops should be sent to syria and `` sent back '' to iraq to defeat the so-called islamic state .

`` if you 're running for president of the united states and you do not understand that we can not defend this nation without more of our soldiers over there , you 're not ready for this job , '' he said .

documents.title: meanwhile , in canada
text: while much of the us will be watching events in cleveland , the neighbours to the north are having a debate of their own .

canadian prime minister stephen harper will spar in toronto with the other party leaders - new democratic party 's thomas mulcair , the liberal party 's justin trudeau and elizabeth may of the green party - ahead of the autumn election .
cbc news has

documents.title: why cleveland ?
text: the location of the debate , cleveland , is significant because ohio is a competitive election state .
no republican candidate has ever won the presidential election without winning the state .
the republican national convention will also be held in cleveland in 2016 and ohio governor john kasich will take the debate stage tonight .

documents.title: meet chris wallace
text: so let 's meet mr wallace , the veteran host of fox news sunday .
he
mr wallace has interviewed president obama multiple times , and in 2012 , he interviewed all the republican presidential candidates .
brett baier and megyn kelly will be helping mr wallace to moderate .

documents.title: fiorina impresses
text: earlier , the seven candidates who failed to make the cut had a debate on the same cleveland stage .
carly fiorina , the former boss of hewlett packard and the only woman in the race ,
chris wallace of fox news , who will chair the debate later , was

documents.title: the top 10 are
text: selected by fox news and based on recent polls , the 10 on stage will be :

documents.title: hello and welcome
text: this is our live coverage of the republican debate in cleveland which features 10 candidates competing for the party 's presidential nomination .
